com.jordanzimmerman
Interface SRPRunner

All Known Implementing Classes:
SRPClientSessionRunner, SRPServerSessionRunner
public interface SRPRunner

General interface for running through a session.

Here is boilerplate code: 

        SRPRunner               runner = ...
        while ( runner.next() )
        {
                if ( runner.hasOutput() )
                {
                        BigInteger              output = runner.getOutput();
                        // TODO: send output to corresponding client/server
                }

                if ( runner.needsInput() )
                {
                        // TODO: get BigInteger from corresponding client/server
                        BigInteger              i = ... // read from client/server
                        runner.setInput(i);
                }
        }

        // at this point, runner.success() can be called to determine if authentication was successful.

Released into the public domain

Author:
Jordan Zimmerman - jordan@jordanzimmerman.com
See Also:
for boilerplate code

Method Summary
 java.math.BigInteger getOutput()
          Return the int that needs to be sent to the corresponding client/server
 byte[] getSessionKey()
          If authentication has succeeded, this value can be used as an encryption key.
 boolean hasOutput()
          Returns true if there is an int that needs to be sent to the corresponding client/server.
 boolean needsInput()
          Returns true if an int from the corresponding client/server is needed to continue.
 boolean next()
          Call until false is returned.
 void setInput(java.math.BigInteger i)
          Set the needed input for the next loop
 boolean success()
          Returns true if authentication has succeeded.
 

Method Detail

next

boolean next()
             throws SRPAuthenticationFailedException
Call until false is returned. Once false is returned, success() can be checked and, if it returns true, getSessionKey() can be used to encrypt communications.

Returns:
true/false
Throws:
SRPAuthenticationFailedException - if an exchanged value caused authentication to fail

needsInput

boolean needsInput()
Returns true if an int from the corresponding client/server is needed to continue. setInput(java.math.BigInteger) must be called before next() is called again.

Returns:
true/false

setInput

void setInput(java.math.BigInteger i)
Set the needed input for the next loop

Parameters:
i - the input (from the corresponding client/server)

hasOutput

boolean hasOutput()
Returns true if there is an int that needs to be sent to the corresponding client/server. getOutput() will return the int which should immediately be sent to the corresponding client/server.

Returns:
true/false

getOutput

java.math.BigInteger getOutput()
Return the int that needs to be sent to the corresponding client/server

Returns:
the int

success

boolean success()
Returns true if authentication has succeeded. Only valid after next() has returned false.

Returns:
true/false

getSessionKey

byte[] getSessionKey()
If authentication has succeeded, this value can be used as an encryption key. Only valid after next() has returned false and success() has returned true.

Returns:
true/false
